modList.title: Xpress Python examples
modList.p: Examples of using Xpress from Python

modDir.title: Python examples using the Xpress Optimizer

model.title: Using NumPy arrays to create variables
model.modDescr: Use NumPy arrays for creating a 3-dimensional array of variables, then use it to create a model.

model.title: Visualize the BB tree
model.modDescr: Shows how to visualize the BB tree of a problem after (partially) solving it.

model.title: Irreducible Infeasible Sets
model.modDescr: Shows how to analyze an infeasible problem by retrieving an irreducible infeasible subset

model.title: Loading a problem
model.modDescr: Shows how directly load a problem and solve it in Python

model.title: Modeling with user functions
model.modDescr: Shows how to create and solve a nonlinear problem whose constraints and objective functions are defined as user functions

model.title: Using Python model objects to build a problem
model.modDescr: Demonstrate how variables, or arrays thereof, and constraints, or arrays of constraints, can be added into a problem. Prints the solution and all attributes/controls of the problem.

model.title: Using Python model objects to build a problem
model.modDescr: Using the compact xpress.problem() declaration to add variables, constraints and objective in one instruction.

model.title: Changing the optimization problem
model.modDescr: Changing an optimization problem using the Xpress Python interface.

model.title: Extending a problem
model.modDescr: Construct a problem using addVariable and addConstraint, then use the Xpress API routines to amend the problem with rows and quadratic terms.

model.title: Using NumPy and Xpress
model.modDescr: An example of printing a matrix of random numbers and a problem formulation that uses the xpress.Dot() operator to formulate constraints simply. Note that the NumPy dot operator is not suitable here as the result is an expression in the Xpress variables.

model.title: Finding an LP subsystem with as many constraints as possible
model.modDescr: Given an infeasible LP, find the feasible subsystem of constraints of maximum cardinality.

model.title: Solving a quadratically constrained problem
model.modDescr: Solve a quadratically constrained problem

model.title: Solving a nonconvex quadratic problem
model.modDescr: Solve a nonconvex quadratic problem

model.title: Solving a quadratically problem
model.modDescr: Solve a quadratic problem

model.title: Repeatedly solving a problem
model.modDescr: Reads a problem, solves it, then adds a constraint and re-solves it

model.title: Using indicators
model.modDescr: Construct a problem from scratch with variables of various types. Adds indicator constraints, Special Ordered Sets (SOSs), and shows how to retrieve such data once it has been added to the problem using the API functions

model.title: The travelling salesman problem
model.modDescr: Retrieves an example fromn http://www.math.uwaterloo.ca/tsp/world/countries.html and creates a corresponding TSP instance, then solves it using the Xpress Optimizer library with the appropriate callback. Once the optimization is over (i.e. the time limit is reached or we find an optimal solution) the optimal tour is displayed using matplotlib.

model.title: Solving a TSP using NumPy
model.modDescr: A randomly generated TSP problem is modeled using NumPy vectors and matrices and solved using the Optimizer's libraries and callback functions.

model.title: Writing and reading problem files
model.modFeatures: Writing and reading a problem to disk
model.modDescr: Create a few variables, then build a problem and save it to a file. Re-read that file into a new problem and solve it

model.title: The feasiblity pump
model.modFeatures: Writing and reading a problem to disk
model.modDescr: Feasibility pump (prototype) using the Xpress Python interface.

model.title: Knapsack problem
model.modDescr: Example of a knapsack problem formulated with the Xpress Python interface.

model.title: The n-queens problem
model.modDescr: The n queens: place n queens on an nxn chessboard so that none of them can be eaten in one move.

model.title: Min-cost-flow problem
model.modDescr: solving a min-cost-flow problem using the Xpress Python interface.

model.title: Solving Sudoku
model.modDescr: Place numbers from 1 to 9 into a 9x9 grid such that no number repeats in any row, in any column, and in any 3x3 sub-grid.

model.title: Comparing Matrices
model.modDescr: Load the coefficient matrices of two optimization problems saved in MPS or LP format using the Xpress Optimizer libraries and compare each line by line using SciPy's matrix routines.

model.title: Multicommodity flow problem
model.modFeatures: Solve a multicommodity flow minimum cost optimization problem on a randomly created graph
model.modDescr: Create a random directed graph using NumPy's random functions and then model and solve a minimum-cost multicommodity flow problem constructed on that graph.

model.title: Find largest-area inscribed polygon
model.modDescr: Given n, find the n-sided polygon of largest area inscribed in the unit circle.

model.title: Read problem data into matrix and vectors
model.modDescr: Obtain coefficient matrix, objective coefficients, and constraints' right-hand sides for a given problem.

model.title: Solve a nonconvex MIQCQP problem
model.modDescr: Reformulate a MIQCQP into a MILP and add callbacks to enforce quadratic feasibility of the nonconvex constraints.

model.title: Solve a simple MIP using Benders decomposition
model.modDescr: Solve a simple MIP using Benders decomposition. Courtesy of Georgios Patsakis (UC Berkeley, Amazon) and Richard L.-Y. Chen (Amazon).

model.title: Solving a quadratically constrained problem
model.modDescr: Define the well-known Rosenbrock function and minimize it.

model.title: Solve a polynomial optimization problem
model.modDescr: Create a random polynomial of degree k using the Dot operator and find its minimum using the Nonlinear solver.
